snippet: The five permanent Security Council members are cracking the door open on the process for choosing the next secretary general, but they retain the authority to ultimately decide.
abstract: Five permanent United Nations Security Council members agree to allow member states to submit candidates for next secretary general, but they will retain authority to make ultimate choice.
lead_paragraph: The five permanent Security Council members are cracking the door open on the process for choosing the next secretary general, but they retain the authority to ultimately decide.

headline.main: World Powers Relax the Process for Picking a U.N. Leader, Slightly
headline.print_headline: World Powers Relax the Process for Picking a U.N. Leader, Slightly
